titleStmt.title: Description of An Judeo-Arabic translation of the Torah and the Five Scrolls.

availability.licence: This metadata, accompanying images, and the content of London, British Library, Oriental Manuscripts Or 14020 A: An Judeo-Arabic translation of the Torah and the Five Scrolls. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. notesStmt.note: Damp, with tidemarks across the leaves. Usage stains, mould spotting. Slight worming. Losses at edges, all infilled before rebinding.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: An Judeo-Arabic translation of the Torah and the Five Scrolls.

msItem.title: Targum ῾aravi le-Torah ve-ḥamesh megilot תרגום ערבי לתורה וחמש מגלות

collation.p: Quires of mostly 6 to 8 leaves each.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental semi-cursive script of the 16th century. Isakhar ben Mordekhai Susan: inscribed in the colophon, folio 127v (autograph).

binding.p: Post-1600. Brown leather, blind tooled. Spine: 'Pentateuch. Judeo-Arabic. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental Ms. 14020A.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Purchased by the British Library in 1981. Previously in the Sassoon Collection, no. 159.
